command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $domain='example.com'; $out='C:\ProgramData\recon\clearbit_company_find_example.com.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path C:\ProgramData\recon | Out-Null; $log='C:\ProgramData\recon\recon.log'; try { $token=$env:CLEARBIT_API_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($token)){ throw 'CLEARBIT_API_KEY not set'; } $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Bearer $token"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $uri="https://company.clearbit.com/v2/companies/find?domain=$domain"; $resp=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Get -UseBasicParsing -TimeoutSec 30 -ErrorAction Stop; if(($resp.StatusCode -ge 200) -and ($resp.StatusCode -lt 300) -and ($resp.Headers['Content-Type'] -match 'application/json')){ ($resp.Content | ConvertFrom-Json) | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 | Set-Content -Path $out -Encoding UTF8 } else { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Clearbit non-success or non-JSON for $domain. Status=$($resp.StatusCode)" } } catch { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Clearbit error for $domain: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Uses Clearbit’s paid company lookup API (closed-source) to obtain organization details tied to the domain and securely persist results.
rationale_steps: Authenticate using a bearer token without exposing it in logs.
Request company details from the closed-source API over TLS.
Check for JSON response and store it in structured form.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quotes/braces, appropriate error handling, and correct use of PowerShell cmdlets and methods.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by using Clearbit's paid API service to gather non-public company information about a domain, with proper error handling, logging, and secure storage of results.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced delimiters, valid parameters, proper separators, and no obvious parsing errors.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Queries Clearbit’s paid company API using bearer auth to retrieve organization data for a domain and saves JSON results, directly exemplifying use of a closed commercial source per T1597.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper syntax for variables, cmdlets, parameters, and flow control (try-catch, if-else).
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by querying a known paid, closed-source intelligence API (Clearbit) to gather organization details for a domain, matching the technique's goal of acquiring non-public information for targeting.
